intro: Nephroia ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaved nephroia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
